content:
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) could you give https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/670 an eyeball? Others welcome as well of course. Wednesday's security release we encountered a problem with sending the email notifications.

Sending security announcement emails prevents saving nodes · Issue #670 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Today when we went to edit and then save the SA for today's security release, the browser hung for about 60 seconds, then the server threw a SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1205 Lock wait timeo...

approved by me; https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/pull/672

Issue #670: Delay sending security emails until after node is saved. by quicksketch · Pull Request #672 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Fixes #670.
we should consider spinning up mailhog in the .lando.yml file

@Nate Lampton is this ini_set() here permanent?: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/pull/672/files#diff-aa231d71d1b21eb93c1a62dafc792648R170

Issue #670: Delay sending security emails until after node is saved. by quicksketch · Pull Request #672 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Fixes #670.

...it seems so. Not 100% sure, but should we be doing an ini_get('max_execution_time'); before setting it to 300, and then at the end of this function reset to what it was before we set it. ...if that's not how things work and I'm being silly, then please ignore me :sweat_smile:

I suppose we could shorten it again. It's intended to be permanent. It basically guarantees that the max execution time is at least 5 minutes. But as this will only fire when it's sending emails, it's not going to happen very frequently.

Oops, this should have been in that previous commit. Just found it uncommitted on my copy. Pushed this up as well to only increase if lower: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/commit/d6ad62ff239fb6e089027c8914ea16050a1c191f

Issue #670: Only increase time if it's less than the current amount. · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org@d6ad62f
